intro: Drimyspermum clerodendron, commonly known as the purple-flowered clerodendron, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and clusters of tubular, violet-colored flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it a valuable species for ecological studies and traditional medicine.
